discoveredAssets: localhost:8080 - Flask web application (Werkzeug 3.1.3, Python 3.13.3) - Port 8080, SOAP integration
localhost:8080/ - Login page (GET, HEAD, OPTIONS) - Main entry point
localhost:8080/login - Authentication endpoint (GET, HEAD, POST, OPTIONS) - Form-based login, returns 401 on invalid credentials
localhost:8080/dashboard - Protected dashboard (GET, HEAD, OPTIONS) - Requires authentication, redirects to /login (302)
localhost:8080/logout - Logout endpoint - Session termination, redirects to /login (302)
localhost:8080/console - Werkzeug Interactive Debugger Console - CRITICAL: PIN-protected Python REPL, EVALEX=true, SECRET exposed in HTML
localhost:8080/wsdl - SOAP WSDL endpoint - Returns 200 OK with application/xml content-type (empty body without authentication)
localhost:8080/static/style.css - Static CSS file - Reveals application features: dashboard, SOAP accountInfo/accountHolderInfo display

targets.objective: Test Werkzeug debugger console for PIN bypass vulnerabilities, weak PIN generation, authentication bypass, and remote code execution. Attempt to exploit the exposed SECRET token (DDsqfqhzsd3B1gq3VL9h) and EVALEX functionality.
targets.rationale: CRITICAL RISK: Interactive Python console exposed allowing arbitrary code execution if PIN is bypassed. This is the highest severity finding - successful exploitation leads to complete system compromise. The console should NEVER be exposed in production.

targets.objective: Test authentication endpoint for SQL injection, NoSQL injection, authentication bypass, timing attacks, credential enumeration, brute force protection, session fixation, and weak password policies.
targets.rationale: HIGH RISK: Primary authentication gateway. Successful bypass provides access to protected dashboard and SOAP functionality. No rate limiting observed, returns 401 on invalid credentials which may enable user enumeration.

targets.objective: Test authenticated dashboard for authorization bypass (accessing without valid session), IDOR vulnerabilities, session management flaws, CSRF on SOAP operations, and business logic issues in account management functionality.
targets.rationale: HIGH RISK: Protected area containing SOAP-based account management features (accountInfo, accountHolderInfo). Requires comprehensive testing once authentication is obtained, including horizontal/vertical privilege escalation and IDOR in account operations.

targets.objective: Test WSDL endpoint and SOAP service for XXE (XML External Entity) injection, SSRF via SOAP requests, XML injection, SOAP parameter tampering, authentication bypass in SOAP operations, and information disclosure through WSDL definitions.
targets.rationale: MEDIUM-HIGH RISK: SOAP service integration with WSDL endpoint exposed. SOAP services are commonly vulnerable to XXE, SSRF, and injection attacks. WSDL may reveal internal service structure and operations. Currently returns empty content - may require authentication or specific parameters.

targets.objective: Test for security header misconfigurations (missing CSP, X-Frame-Options, HSTS), clickjacking vulnerabilities, information disclosure through server headers (Werkzeug version exposed), and development server security issues.
targets.rationale: MEDIUM RISK: Flask application running on Werkzeug development server in production-like environment. Missing all security headers. Development server not intended for production use and may have security weaknesses. Server version disclosure enables targeted attacks.

targets.objective: Test session management implementation including session token entropy, secure cookie flags (HttpOnly, Secure, SameSite), session fixation, session hijacking, concurrent session handling, and logout effectiveness.
targets.rationale: MEDIUM RISK: Session-based authentication system requires thorough testing. Dashboard redirects indicate session checks, but implementation quality unknown. Weak session management enables account takeover.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Werkzeug Interactive Debugger Console exposed at /console - allows arbitrary Python code execution if PIN is bypassed. SECRET token visible in HTML: DDsqfqhzsd3B1gq3VL9h
[HIGH] Flask application running on Werkzeug development server (3.1.3) - development server should never be used in production due to security limitations
[HIGH] Server version disclosure - Werkzeug/3.1.3 Python/3.13.3 exposed in HTTP headers enabling targeted attacks
[HIGH] No security headers present - missing X-Frame-Options, CSP, HSTS, X-XSS-Protection, X-Content-Type-Options
[MEDIUM] SOAP service with WSDL endpoint exposed - potential XXE, SSRF, and injection attack surface
[MEDIUM] WSDL endpoint returns empty content - may require authentication or specific parameters to reveal service definitions
[MEDIUM] Authentication returns generic 401 'Invalid credentials' - may enable username enumeration through timing attacks
[MEDIUM] No rate limiting observed on login endpoint - enables credential brute forcing
[LOW] CSS file reveals application structure - dashboard features and SOAP account management functionality (accountInfo, accountHolderInfo)
[LOW] Session-based authentication with redirects - requires testing for session management vulnerabilities
